circumstances: Irene Morris, an 83-year-old retired engineering professional, was last seen leaving her home on Hyndford Street, Dundee. Reports suggest that she intended to visit her grandmother, Clare Wood, who resides in an assisted living facility. Family members confirm that Irene took the usual route past Fort Street and the nearby train station to reach her destination, but never arrived. Speculation arose that she might have diverted to an alleyway near these locations, possibly becoming disoriented due to a mild cognitive impairment. She was ultimately traced by her family two days later at a physical therapy clinic on Kirsty Semple Way.

Witnesses observed her making her way through an alleyway adjacent to 146 Pitkerro Road, a pathway she had used before to navigate back to her relative's house on occasion. Concern grew when she did not arrive at her relative's home, located near 484 Perth Road. Given her age and known disability, the delay was alarming. Despite a city-wide search, led by local authorities and Irene's family, she remained missing. Fortunately, several days later, a member of the public recognized Irene wandering in a confused state near a residence in Forfar, bringing her distressing journey to an end.
entities_pattern_types: missing after outdoor festival,seeking solitude

circumstances: Irene Morris, an 89-year-old originally from Lancaster, was reported missing from her regular walking route on Pitkerro Road, Dundee. Known for seeking solitude, Irene often diverted from her usual path, sometimes exploring nearby areas. Recently, she had become involved with an unknown online group, causing concern among her acquaintances. She was last seen near the train station as she headed towards an alleyway close to Hyndford Street. Her friend, Jay Hopkins, mentioned that Irene enjoyed outdoor festivals, hinting she might have followed a nearby event. After an extensive search by the authorities, Irene was eventually traced and found at an address on Perth Road, Dundee, in safe condition.
